---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body:
Not sure if we want to have a special name for a theorem of type
`Function.Injective Int.ofNat`
which is just `Int.ofNat.inj` with explicit arguments. If yes, what would be a good name and place for it?
Perhaps this is a use case for using `alias`?
Actually, I do think we should have the Injective lemma as well

> Actually, I do think we should have the Injective lemma as well

What would be a good name and place for it?
`Int.ofNat_injective`, and near `Int.natCast_inj` in `Data.Int.Defs`, perhaps

> `Int.ofNat_injective`, and near `Int.natCast_inj` in `Data.Int.Defs`, perhaps

done

I'm going to test if `Nat.cast_injective` works better in these `rw`s.
UPD: In 1 case it doesn't help (why do we need `erw` there?) ; in other case, expr uses `Nat.cast`, so I rewrote it in terms of `Nat.cast_injective`.

Thanks! Once CI is happy, please merge this PR using `bors r+`
bors d+

:v: mo271 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9249565815/job/25441627446)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9249565815/job/25441627262)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9249565815/job/25441627678)
Looks good to me, pending one question (see below). Thanks!
Looks good to me, pending one question (see below). Thanks!
Do you need the @?

yes, without it I get
```
application type mismatch
  comapDomain.addMonoidHom_apply Int.ofNat.inj
argument
  Int.ofNat.inj
has type
  Int.ofNat ?m.79663 = Int.ofNat ?m.79664 â†’ ?m.79663 = ?m.79664 : Prop
but is expected to have type
  Injective ?m.79662 : Prop
  ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Algebra/Polynomial/Laurent): use Int.ofNat.inj

nodes.body:
Not sure if we want to have a special name for a theorem of type
`Function.Injective Int.ofNat`
which is just `Int.ofNat.inj` with explicit arguments. If yes, what would be a good name and place for it?
Looks good to me, pending one question (see below). Thanks!
Perhaps this is a use case for using `alias`?
Actually, I do think we should have the Injective lemma as well

> Actually, I do think we should have the Injective lemma as well

What would be a good name and place for it?
`Int.ofNat_injective`, and near `Int.natCast_inj` in `Data.Int.Defs`, perhaps

> `Int.ofNat_injective`, and near `Int.natCast_inj` in `Data.Int.Defs`, perhaps

done

I'm going to test if `Nat.cast_injective` works better in these `rw`s.
UPD: In 1 case it doesn't help (why do we need `erw` there?) ; in other case, expr uses `Nat.cast`, so I rewrote it in terms of `Nat.cast_injective`.

Thanks! Once CI is happy, please merge this PR using `bors r+`
bors d+
